meanings.definition: The quality of being able to provoke an immune response.
meanings.sent1: The immunogenicities of the vaccine made it effective in stimulating the immune system.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the immunogenicities of different viruses to understand how they affect the body.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's immunogenicities were so strong that even the villains' attacks couldn't weaken him.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an immunogenicity that spread through the community like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to explain the immunogenicities of germs to the students.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of inducing an immune response.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the immunogenicities of various pathogens is crucial for developing vaccines.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the immunogenicities of the flu virus to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The cat's immunogenicities seemed to make it invincible against common illnesses.
meanings.sent4: His words had an immunogenicity that inspired others to take action.
meanings.sent5: The book vividly described the immunogenicities of different types of allergies.
